benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/block - Block a bundle

covered: Required-success: Happy path for creating a BlockingState (HTTP 201) with required fields (TC01).
Optional inputs: Query params (requestedDate, pluginProperty) and optional headers (Reason, Comment) covered in successful flows (TC02–TC04).
Path parameter validation: Invalid UUID format and non-existent bundleId are tested (TC06, TC07).
Request body validation: Malformed/missing body and invalid date format are tested (TC08, TC10, TC11).
Header validation & auth: Missing required X-Killbill-CreatedBy and invalid auth token tests present (TC09, TC18).
Response verification: Tests assert HTTP status codes and JSON array response with BlockingState objects and field checks (TC01, TC02).
Edge values & limits: Min/max field lengths and large payload tests are present (TC13, TC14, TC16).
Concurrency & resilience: Concurrent requests, retry after transient network error, and service unavailability are covered (TC21, TC22, TC17).
Security: Injection and XSS attempts are included (TC19, TC20).
Integration & consistency: Dependent-service failures and cross-system consistency covered (TC28, TC29).
Regression & compatibility: Special character encoding and backward compatibility scenarios included (TC23, TC24).
Performance: Response-time under normal/peak and resource utilization tests listed (TC25–TC27).
Robustness against unexpected inputs: Extra unexpected parameters behavior is covered (TC12).
gaps: Duplicate submission / idempotency: No explicit scenario for duplicate POSTs (e.g., same payload/resubmission) and how duplicates are handled (dedup token/unique constraints).
Internal server error (500) scenarios: No explicit test that simulates database failures or application 500 errors (distinct from dependent-service 502/503).
Authorization scopes/roles and 403 handling: Tests cover auth token missing/invalid (401) but not role/permission-based authorization resulting in 403.

Exact schema validation variants: While malformed body is covered, there is no explicit coverage for invalid enum values, out-of-range numeric fields, or wrong data types for deeply nested fields in BlockingState beyond "malformed" generic case.
Response header checks: Tests do not assert presence/values of relevant response headers (e.g., Location, Content-Type, or any audit headers).
Duplicate pluginProperty handling: No explicit test for duplicate pluginProperty entries or empty pluginProperty arrays and their semantics.
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests for client/request rate limiting or server throttling behavior.
Idempotency/transaction semantics under failure: No scenario that verifies whether retrying after partial failure causes double-creation or if transactions are atomic.
Schema evolution error handling: No negative tests for unknown/new fields in request when backward compatibility should be preserved beyond TC12 generic extra params.
recommendations: Add a Duplicate Submission test: send the same BlockingState twice (immediately) and assert deduplication behavior or proper error/200/201 semantics and no duplicate persisted states. Include tests with an idempotency key if supported.
Add 500/Internal Server Error simulations: inject DB failures or simulate unexpected exceptions and assert HTTP 500 and appropriate error body (and that partial writes are rolled back).
Add Authorization/Permission tests: assert 403 responses when an authenticated user lacks permission to block bundles; test roles/scopes if relevant.
Expand schema-negative tests: create focused cases for invalid enum values, out-of-range numeric fields, deeply nested wrong types and ensure descriptive 4xx validation errors.
Assert response headers: include checks for Content-Type, Location (if applicable), and any audit headers returned by the service.
PluginProperty edge-cases: test duplicate pluginProperty entries, empty arrays, and extremely large numbers of pluginProperty items.
Rate limiting and throttling: include tests that hammer the endpoint to ensure proper throttling/rate-limit responses (429) and graceful degradation.
Transaction/idempotency semantics on failures: test partial failure + retry to ensure no double-creation and consistent state across retries (combine with 500 simulation).
Add test to validate exact effectiveDate handling: ensure requestedDate and computed effective date in response follow specified precedence/format rules (explicit timezone/UTC behavior).
